title.native: 魔入りました！入間くん 第2シリーズ
title.english: Welcome to Demon School! Iruma-kun Season 2

description:
The second season of Mairimashita! Iruma-kun.

Suzuki Iruma, human and deeply non-aggressive, one day becomes the grandson of the great demon Sullivan. Doted on beyond belief, Iruma starts school where "Grandpa" serves as the chair... and finds, to his surprise, that he enjoys life there with Asmodeus, Clara, and the rest of his demon classmates. But just when Iruma thought he'd fitted in, there's more trouble ahead! A ring begins to talk, and Iruma... goes bad?! Iruma's chaotic, demonic life at school continues!

(Source: NHK)
synonyms: Welcome to Demon School, Iruma-kun! Season 2
入间同学入魔了 第二季
อิรุมะคุง พจญในแดนปีศาจ! ภาค 2

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/81658029) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akimitsuhomma/) | [Website](https://akimitsuhomma.com/)

He was part of the music group [Vink](https://anilist.co/staff/228057/).

__[Website](https://dapump.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/DAPUMPJP)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dapumpjp)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/DAPUMPch)__

__Formed:__ 1996

__Introduction:__
DA PUMP is a Japanese boy band under record label SONIC GROOVE (2011-), having previously been under record label avex tune (1997-2010)

__Members:__
- [Issa Hentona](https://anilist.co/staff/216060) (辺土名一茶) – leader, vocalist, MC (1996-)
- Daichi Kato (加藤大地) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomoki Nakamura (中村朋揮) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomohiro Taniguchi (谷口知広) – MC, dancer(2008-)
- [Kimitaka Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/163044/Kimitaka-Kondou) (近藤公貴) – MC, dancer (2008-)
- YORI – dancer, chorus (2008-)
- Yuuya Tanimoto (谷本裕也) – dancer, MC, chorus (2008-)

__Former Members:__
- Shinobu Miyara (宮良忍) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2005)
- Yukinari Tamaki (玉城幸也) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2008)
- Ken Okumoto (奥本健) – choreographer, lead MC, dance, chorus (1996-2009)
- Kazuma Yamane (山根和馬) (2008–2013)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)

__Height:__ 173 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ta2hisa_suzuki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ta2hisa_suzuki/)

Tatsuhisa is a Japanese voice actor and singer, and he is affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Lantis. He is the vocalist of the rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) under his stage name Ta_2, who also provides the opening/ending themes of many of the anime he stars in. He not only sings but also composes some of the songs. He also belongs to Style Five, in charge of the endings of Free! He also likes bicycling, karaoke, reading and video games. 

He is known for his numerous roles in anime series, his main breakout roles in the West were as Takao in Kuroko no Basuke and especially as Makoto Tachibana in Free!. He is not only known for his voice in anime, but also in video games. For example, he gave voice to Noctis (FFXV) and Alfonse (FEH). 

He is married to the famous singer [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561/LiSA). In late July 2021, it was reported that he was involved in an affair with a 20-year old fan. The next month he announced that he would suspend all entertainment activities due to poor health, later issuing an apology for his "irresponsible and inappropriate actions". His agency stated that he would gradually resume activities while recovering. In March 2022, his agency announced his full return to work from hiatus, along with another apology to fans.

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ Intention 

[Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A023615.html) | [Official Site](http://toyamanao.com/) | [Official Club](http://fc.toyamanao.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/toyamanao/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/naobou_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naobou_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/naobou_channel) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nao_T%C5%8Dyama) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%B1%E5%B1%B1%E5%A5%88%E5%A4%AE)

__Radio Programs:__
- (2014-2017) Touyama Nao's Dream * Theater
- (2017-) Touyama Nao's Radio @ Living

__Awards:__ 
- (2019-03-09) Best Supporting Actress Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- (2019-03-09) Game Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards

__Early Life & Education__
She was born in Tokyo on March 11, 1992. Her father had spent 9 years abroad and was fluent in English, which allowed her to develop fluency in the language. From an early age she had an interest in anime, in particular the series _Ojamajo Doremi_ and _Sailor Moon_. However, it was the anime series _Fullmetal Alchemist_ that was the first to inspire her to become a voice actress. At the time, she was impressed that the series' protagonist Edward Elric was voiced by a female actress, [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park).

In junior high school and high school, she became part of a chorus club to help her overcome her tone deafness. It was also during this time she decided to pursue a voice acting career as she had interacted with schoolmates who had similar interests. Her parents approved of her decision, provided that she pass her university entrance exams. 

__Voice Acting Career__
While in high school, she began attending the Japan Narration Acting Institute. After 3 years of training, she passed her audition and joined the agency Arts Vision. At the same time, she also passed her entrance exam and began studying at Waseda University. She debuted as a voice actress in 2010 and later that year she played her first main role in the anime series _The World God Only Knows_. Throughout her 4 years in University, she continued to work as a voice actress, successfully managing both her work and school responsibilities. She graduated in March 2014 and left Art Vision shortly after on April 1. On May 1, 2014, she transferred to the agency Intention and is currently affiliated with them today.

__Music Career__
Her music career began when she released songs for _The World God Only Knows_ under her character name Kanon Nakagawa. In 2013, she became part of the music group Rhodanthe*, which performed theme songs for the _Kiniro Mosaic_ series. After having been cast in 2015, she has also released singles as her Idolmaster character Mizuki Kawashima. In 2016, she voiced a member of the in-universe music group Walküre, which performed songs for the anime series _Macross Δ_.

In 2017, she made her solo debut as a singer on February 1 with the release of her single "True Destiny" / "Chain the World" under the Flying Dog label. Later that year, her second single "Ima Koko" / "Tsuki ga Kirei" was released on May 24 as well as her first album _Rainbow_ on October 25. In 2018, she held her first solo live event at the Nippon Budokan on February 3 and released her third single "Tomoshibi no Manima ni" on May 30. In 2019, she released her second album _Gunjou Infinity_ on April 3. During the months of August and September, she held her first tour live event performing in the cities of Osaka, Nagoya, and Yokohama as well as cities outside of Japan like Taipei and Shanghai. In 2020, her fourth single "Aruite Ikou!" is set to release on February 5.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Misono Mika in "Blue Archive" (VG)
- Mualani in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Juna Crawford - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mello__vitor/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VitorMelloVO) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/vitor.melomoraes)

Vitor Mello de Moraes is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director. He is the younger brother of former voice actor [Bruno Mello](https://anilist.co/staff/231430/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Charles "Charlie" Spring (Heartstopper)
- Colin Bridgerton (Bridgerton)
- Valerio Montesinos Rojas (Elite)
- Samuel Douglas "Sam" Gardner IV (Atypical)
- Carlos Victor Rodriguez (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Luka Colucci (Rebelde 2022)
- Peter Doppler (Dark)
- Billy Andrews (Anne with an E)
- Inojin Yamanaka (Naruto X Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections)
- Kitty (Battle Kitty)
- Diazo (Strange World)
- Benjamin "Ben" Florian (Descendants: The Royal Wedding)
- Jeong Jin-Hwan (A Love So Beautiful)
- Teylan (Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora)
- Fjor Jutul (Ragnarok)
- Mark Tedder (Blood & Water)
!~
